definition: secretariat
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Cheng Donghong is the executive secretary of China Association for Science and Technology.
sentences.chinese: 程东红是中国科学技术协会书记处书记。

sentences.english: After the congress, the secretariat moved from Shanghai to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 代表大会召开之后，书记处由上海迁到了北京。

sentences.english: Wang Gang, member of Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee and other escorts arrived in the same plane.
sentences.chinese: 中共中央书记处书记王刚等陪同人员也同机抵达。

sentences.english: Wang Gang, member of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee, and other officials attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 中共中央书记处书记王刚等参加了会见。

sentences.english: Director Wang Gang of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee and other accompanying officials arrived at Chile by the same plane.
sentences.chinese: 中共中央书记处书记王刚等陪同人员同机抵达。

sentences.english: At that time, the Secretariat of the Central Committee discussed Comrade Luo Ronghuan's views and concurred with them.
sentences.chinese: 当时书记处讨论，赞成罗荣桓同志的这个意见。

sentences.english: Wang Gang, Member of the Secretariat of the Central Committee and other accompanying staffs also arrived at the airport by the same plane.
sentences.chinese: 中共中央书记处书记王刚等陪同人员也同机抵达。
